metadata.title: CVE-2021-47201 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: iavf:free q_vectors before queues in iavf_disable_vf iavf_free_queues() clearsadapter->num_active_queues, which iavf_free_q_vectors() relies on, so swapthe order of these two function calls in iavf_disable_vf(). This resolves apanic encountered when the interface is disabled and then later brought upagain after PF communication is restored.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47201` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-97.110~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-97.110~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-97.110~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-97.110~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-97.110~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1104-aws - 5.4.0-1064.67~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1110-azure - 5.4.0-1068.71~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1107-gcp - 5.4.0-1063.67~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-ibm - 5.4.0-1014.15~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1103-oracle - 5.4.0-1062.66~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1088-raspi - 5.4.0-1052.58~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
